# NEUROBEHAVIORAL STATUS EXAM {#nse}

## Notification/Informed Consent

Biggie Smalls consented to undergo the current neuropsychological evaluation. {{< var he_she_cap >}} was informed nothing we discussed would remain confidential, and information {{< var he_she >}} provided during our meetings and the test results from my evaluation of him would become a part of my report, to be used at {{< var his_her >}} attorney's discretion. {{< var he_she_cap >}} was informed a copy of any report I produced would be sent to {{< var his_her >}} attorney, possibly to the prosecuting attorney, and to the court. Mr. Smalls indicated having understood the purpose of the evaluation and the limitations of confidentiality of our interviews and the testing I conducted.

On {{< var doe1 >}}, I conducted a clinical interview with Mrs. Smalls, Biggie Smalls' biological mother, via a HIPAA-compliant telehealth platform, gathering data on {{< var his_her >}} developmental, medical, and psychosocial histories. The following day ({{< var doe1 >}}), I performed an in-person neuropsychological and psychodiagnostic evaluation of {{< var mr_mrs >}} {{< var last_name >}}, which lasted approximately eight hours.

This report is based on a review of available information contained in medical records and criminal records, as well as interviews with Mr. Smalls, {{< var his_her >}} mother Mrs. Smalls, attorney XX, and information gathered during multiple days of evaluation. I reserve the right to change my opinions about the following should I be provided additional records that alter my understanding of the findings. Please note my current employer, Keck School of Medicine of USC, is neither involved nor affiliated with this case, and that the patient was referred to me by {{< var his_her >}} attorney's office.

## Reason for Referral

Biggie Smalls is a XX-year-old, left-handed male with XX years of education. {{< var he_she_cap >}}
was referred for forensic examination to elucidate the nature and extent of
neurocognitive sequelae stemming from a history of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). The purpose of
this evaluation was to identify or rule-out any objectively-derived
neurocognitive impairments in Mr. Smalls. This process is necessary in
determining whether Mr. Smalls's atypical neurocognitive development and
impoverished psychosocial upbringing were contributing factors in XYZ.
